comments:
build i0125-0800, winxp

Sorry, don't think its consistently reproducable. 

I was debugging some startup code in InternalPlatform and hit a breakpoint. I stepped through it, browsed some variables, then realized the error of my ways and killed the thread.

This brought several message dialogs saying that an error occurred. When I checked in the log file, I had a lot of exceptions. Here is an example. I will attach the full session log file.

Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.viewers.AsynchronousTreeViewer.doAttemptSelectionToWidget(AsynchronousTreeViewer.java:767)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.viewers.AsynchronousViewer.restoreSelection(AsynchronousViewer.java:947)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.viewers.AsynchronousViewer.preservingSelection(AsynchronousViewer.java:927)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.viewers.AsynchronousTreeViewer.handleEvent(AsynchronousTreeViewer.java:562)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.EventTable.sendEvent(EventTable.java:66)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.sendEvent(Widget.java:920)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.sendEvent(Widget.java:944)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.sendEvent(Widget.java:929)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Tree.checkData(Tree.java:374)

Created an attachment (id=33639)
error dialog

Hmm...looks like I am in a weird state now. I tried starting up another debug session and it starts eventually but I get the following dialog with lots of errors in it. The same stack traces appear in the log file.

So far I haven't been able to reproduce this (on mac). How are you terminating the thread?
Does closing/reopening the Debug View put you back into a happy state again?
I killed it by hitting the stop icon in the Debug view. Didn't try closing the view and re-opening. Will try that if it happens again...
It happened again and I just closed and re-opened the Debug view and it was back in a managable state.
The AsynchronousTreeViewer has been re-written over the last two weeks. Please re-open if still a problem (new class is AsynchronousTreeModelViewer). We have not reproduced the problem.
